SENT.plain: The article reports on 5 patients with polytrauma or who had undergone major surgery of the long bones
In all 5 patients there was acute respiratory insufficiency, and, in addition, a comatose condition lasting for a shorter or greater length of time
In 4 out of these 5 patients, tachypnea occurred despite normalisation of the pO2
Petechial hemorrhages occurred in 3 patients at the trunk
All patients rapidly overcame the acute respiratory insufficiency; no pulmonary shock syndrome developed
In case of acute respiratory insufficiency, especially if associated with comatose conditions, central fatty embolism should always be considered a differential diagnostic possibility
